# nuxt-guided-tour

> A guided tour and onboarding module for Nuxt applications.

nuxt-guided-tour is an open-source Nuxt module that adds step-by-step guided tours to Nuxt 3 and Nuxt 4 applications. It is WCAG 2.1 AA compliant with full keyboard navigation, screen reader support via ARIA live regions, and dark mode support.

## Key Features

- Step-by-step guided tours with animated highlight rings
- Optional welcome modal and informational intro slides before the tour
- Keyboard navigation (Arrow keys to navigate, Escape to cancel)
- ARIA live region announcements for screen readers
- Dark mode support with separate color variables
- Reduced motion support (WCAG 2.3.3)
- localStorage persistence with versioned keys (won't re-show to returning users)
- Auto-detection of overflow:hidden elements (uses outline instead of pseudo-elements)
- Fully customizable via ~30 CSS custom properties, props, and a theme template file

## Requirements

- Nuxt 3 or Nuxt 4
- @nuxt/ui >= 3.0.0 (for popover/dialog components)
- @vueuse/core >= 10.0.0 (for reactive utilities)

This is NOT a framework-agnostic library. It is built specifically for Nuxt.

## Installation

```
npm install nuxt-guided-tour @nuxt/ui @vueuse/core
```

Add to nuxt.config.ts:

```
export default defineNuxtConfig({
  modules: ['nuxt-guided-tour'],
})
```

## Components

- TourOverlay: Main tour dialog with step content, navigation, and keyboard handling
- TourTrigger: Button to manually start/restart the tour
- TourWelcome: Optional welcome modal asking if users want to take the tour
- TourIntro: Optional informational slides before the hands-on tour

## Composable

useTour(config) returns tour state and navigation methods:
- State: isActive, currentStep, currentStepIndex, progress, hasCompletedTour
- Navigation: start(), next(), previous(), cancel(), complete(), goToStep()
- Utilities: getStepById(), getStepIndex(), markAsSeen(), resetCompletion()
